workflow.name: Download Facebook videos to Google Drive with automated logging in sheets
workflow.description:
### üöÄ [Facebook to MP4 Video Downloader](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11) ‚Äì Fully Customizable Automated Workflow  

Easily convert Facebook videos into downloadable MP4 files using **[Facebook Video Downloader API](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11)**.  
This n8n workflow automates fetching videos, downloading them, uploading them to Google Drive, and logging results in Google Sheets.  
Users can **modify and extend** this flow according to their own needs (e.g., add email notifications, change storage location, or use another API).  

---

### üìù **Node-by-Node Explanation**

1. **On form submission** ‚Üí Triggers when a user submits a Facebook video URL via the form. *(You can customize this form to include email or multiple URLs.)*  
2. **Facebook RapidAPI Request** ‚Üí Sends a POST request to [**Facebook Video Downloader API**](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11) to fetch downloadable MP4 links. *(Easily replace or update API parameters as needed.)*  
3. **If Node** ‚Üí Checks API response for errors before proceeding. *(You can add more conditions to handle custom error scenarios.)*  
4. **MP4 Downloader** ‚Üí Downloads the Facebook video file from the received media URL. *(You can change download settings, add quality filters, or store multiple resolutions.)*  
5. **Upload to Google Drive** ‚Üí Uploads the downloaded MP4 file to a Google Drive folder. *(Easily switch to Dropbox, S3, or any other storage service.)*  
6. **Google Drive Set Permission** ‚Üí Sets the uploaded file to be publicly shareable. *(You can make it private or share only with specific users.)*  
7. **Google Sheets** ‚Üí Logs successful conversions with the original URL and shareable MP4 link. *(Customizable for additional fields like video title, size, or download time.)*  
8. **Wait Node** ‚Üí Delays before logging failed conversions to avoid rapid writes. *(You can adjust the wait duration or add retry attempts.)*  
9. **Google Sheets Append Row** ‚Üí Records failed conversion attempts with `N/A` as the Drive URL. *(You can add notification alerts for failed downloads.)*  

---

### ‚úÖ **Use Cases**

- Automate Facebook video downloads for social media teams  
- Instantly generate shareable MP4 links for clients or marketing campaigns  
- Maintain a centralized log of downloaded videos for reporting  
- Customizable flow for different video quality, formats, or storage needs  

### üöÄ **Benefits**

- Fast and reliable Facebook video downloading with [**Facebook Video Downloader API**](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11)  
- Flexible and fully customizable ‚Äì adapt nodes, storage, and notifications as required  
- Automatic error handling and logging in Google Sheets  
- Cloud-based storage with secure and shareable Google Drive links  
- Seamless integration with n8n and [**Facebook Video Downloader API**](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11) for scalable automation  

---  
üîë **Resolved:** Manual Facebook video downloads are now fully automated, customizable, and scalable using [**Facebook Video Downloader API**](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11), Google Drive uploads, and detailed logging via Google Sheets.

parameters.content:
## üü¢ **1. On form submission**
- **Purpose:** Acts as the trigger for the workflow.  
- **Functionality:** Displays a form with a single field (`URL`) where users can enter the Facebook video link.  
- **Output:** Passes the entered URL to the next node for processing.

## üåê **2. Facebook RapidAPI Request**
- **Purpose:** Fetch downloadable MP4 link.  
- **Functionality:** Sends a `POST` request to **Facebook Video Downloader API**, passing the URL from the form.  
- **Output:** Receives a JSON response containing downloadable media links.

## üîç **3. If**
- **Purpose:** Check for API errors.  
- **Functionality:** Evaluates if the response contains an `error` field.  
- **Output:** 
  - ‚úÖ **True Path:** Proceeds to download the MP4.  
  - ‚ùå **False Path:** Goes to error handling (Wait + Sheets logging).

## ‚¨áÔ∏è **4. MP4 Downloader**
- **Purpose:** Download the video file.  
- **Functionality:** Uses the media URL from the previous API response to download the MP4 video.  
- **Output:** Stores the raw MP4 binary for upload.

-

## ‚òÅÔ∏è **5. Upload To Google Drive**
- **Purpose:** Store video in Google Drive.  
- **Functionality:** Uploads the downloaded MP4 into the specified Drive folder.  
- **Output:** Returns a file ID for the uploaded file.

## üîë **6. Google Drive Set Permission**
- **Purpose:** Make the file publicly accessible.  
- **Functionality:** Sets file permissions to `Anyone with the link can view`.  
- **Output:** Provides a sharable `webViewLink`.

## üìÑ **7. Google Sheets**
- **Purpose:** Log successful conversions.  
- **Functionality:** Appends a row with:
  - `URL` ‚Üí Original Facebook link  
  - `Drive_URL` ‚Üí Sharable Google Drive MP4 link  
- **Output:** Saves a permanent log of successful downloads.

## ‚è±Ô∏è **8. Wait**
- **Purpose:** Delay before logging failures.  
- **Functionality:** Pauses workflow execution to avoid instant sheet logging when API errors occur.  
- **Output:** Prevents rapid consecutive writes to Google Sheets.

## üìë **9. Google Sheets Append Row**
- **Purpose:** Log failed conversions.  
- **Functionality:** Appends a row with:
  - `URL` ‚Üí Original LinkedIn link  
  - `Drive_URL` ‚Üí `N/A` (indicating download failure)  
- **Output:** Tracks failed attempts separately.

# üöÄ Facebook to MP4 Video Downloader ‚Äì Automated Workflow  

Easily convert Facebook videos into downloadable MP4 files using **[Facebook Video Downloader API](https://rapidapi.com/skdeveloper/api/facebook-video-downloader11)**.  
This n8n workflow automates fetching the video, downloading it, uploading it to Google Drive, and logging results in Google Sheets.  

---

### üìù **Node-by-Node Explanation**

1. **On form submission** ‚Üí Triggers when a user submits a Facebook video URL via the form.  
2. **Facebook RapidAPI Request** ‚Üí Sends a POST request to **Facebook Video Downloader API** to fetch downloadable MP4 links.  
3. **If Node** ‚Üí Checks API response for errors before proceeding.  
4. **MP4 Downloader** ‚Üí Downloads the Facebook video file from the received media URL.  
5. **Upload to Google Drive** ‚Üí Uploads the downloaded MP4 file to a Google Drive folder.  
6. **Google Drive Set Permission** ‚Üí Sets the uploaded file to be publicly shareable.  
7. **Google Sheets** ‚Üí Logs successful conversions with the original URL and shareable MP4 link.  
8. **Wait Node** ‚Üí Delays before logging failed conversions to avoid rapid writes.  
9. **Google Sheets Append Row** ‚Üí Records failed conversion attempts with `N/A` as the Drive URL.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
